Posts.Content: May 7, 2014 09:27PM dlgmom1 wrote: Thanks for trying!  I have a new mammo and ultrasound scheduled for tomorrow so we shall see!  Unfortunately I've asked a few questions on a couple of boards being pretty new to all of this as well and have never been successful at getting many replies or advice on any of them :( I guess I'm not asking the right questions on the right spot!  So thanks again for your reply- it is greatly appreciated!
Posts.Title: Follow up and new questions dlgmom1 WolfsLady

Posts.Content: dlgmom1 wrote: My oncologist appt is tomorrow to review post-lumpectomy for DCIS MRI, but I received the MRI results myself today.  Basically they found "new foci" abutting the anterior of the lumpectomy site.  8 mm being the one most concerning.  Being referred for another mammogram and ultrasound. Ok soooo- if I've already had two mammos, two diagnostic mammos, and both left and right ultrasounds done BEFORE surgery, wouldn't this have been seen?  I guess my question is do they think it's new?  Also mentioned scattered foci enhancements across both breasts.  Are these foci potential masses?  The one they are looking at is BIRADS 4.  I guess they just want to check again, but it's only been 3 months since surgery...could they have popped up that fast?  Just wondering with all the experience out there what yall think?  Thanks for your help in advance, this is all so confusing! I know I may sound completely ignorant and I really feel that way, so help a girl out! :) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Follow up and new questions dlgmom1 WolfsLady
